comment: Like. Dude. I fucking watched you move them myself. Remember when I asked you if you wanted help and you told me that you were just looking for something?"
“just because it’s in the wrong area don’t mean the price rings wrong”
Helped a regular out because he bought two pieces of beef jerky (jack links), and before I told him the total, I noticed the price seemed off
He ended up calling management. Most of the management had to come and hold a damn tribunal about whether I was telling the truth or not.
As per usual, special was not ringing up.  Ended up saving the dude $3 :D
Ended up that the front end management and the floor management believed me because they all knew me/the regular assholes.

But still the store director and his cronies that barely touched the front end found it impossible that a customer could ever be wrong and that clearly the bags were misplaced by a stocker and that I should be ashamed of myself for calling a customer a li
on customers, those wearing masks and gloves or even if they’re not & they’re wiping everything down and watching what they touch, they need to watch their kids
Wow... you have to be completely naive to think that every single customer is telling the truth and is a perfect little angel who could do no wrong...
WRONG.  There are a lot of people who will try to lie, cheat, steal, and otherwise take advantage of you every chance you get.  They're rare, but they exist.
girl I was with today said she saw a kid press his hands on the glass of the hot case, smush his face on it, and then touch his face
Shame the glass wasn't red hot metal

Thank fuck my immediate management had my back and shut them down. Straight up called out the regular assholes for what they were: known asshole thieves. After that, the guy decided he didn't want rice anyways and left.

she mentions she’s ready when my manager is closer and because she’s also closer, offers to take it for me
but the lady says “oh but she was gonna get me”, pointing at me
now, this isn’t inherently bad until you learn that I am white

we get that a lot at the hardware store, except its that we have a female manager and a bunch of white 'cowboys' for a town population. She gets ignored or disregarded all the time. The whole team has now learned that in those situations
even if we know the answer, ask her the question and go with her answer
train the old sexist bastards that yes, women can be really knowledgeable with 'manly' things like what concrete to use, how to change a light switch, or install a garbage disposal.

that reminds me of when I went to the car dealership for a car maybe a year back
told the dude straight off, ~because he asked~, I specifically wanted something truck or car like, NO suvs
did you get the run-around, and the patronizing talk like you didnt know jack?
what was the first thing he walks me over to?
"I want a truck OR a car, not that unholy abomination that is the inbetween."
after almost snapping that I did not want this car, even after humoring him with a test drive, I walked off to some cars off to the side
a beautiful red cruze sat there, fresh tires, all clean and shiny
told him I liked it but I wasn’t sure about the tint because it was so dark and you could only go so dark before it became illegal
and this dude pipes in with a way too excited “that’s right!”
I do t know the engine, he couldn’t let me in or try it cause it was one they hadn’t registered to sell yet
the insistence he had that I take the suv tho
Must suck to be a cars salesman these days

car fax showed a total loss wreck
and it’d been stolen at one point
Everything else that was listed was either super high mileage (150k+), or super old (2008 or earlier)
sometimes they are Salvage from stupid things that arent important, but structural damage is a no-go for me
Honestly, they shouldn't be able to sell vehicles with frame damage
It's one thing if you own the vehicle and want it repaired
But a lot of places will either try to hide the damage, or not mention it at all
Because they KNOW it's a deal killer

even if its okish safety wise, you never know if it will ever be in alignment again... it might chew through tires like you wouldnt believe, or have handling issues you dont know about untill you need to avoid something
the accident report says it ran off the road ether after something got up underneath and caused loss of control or loss of control occurred and then something got under there
then it went into a ditch, totaling the front, and entire passenger side door area
oh... crud... its late... I need to get to bed...

alright, ive really got to get to bed. Goodnight all!
they did amazing on the restoration - without the report, you’d not know it was trashed
If they did that great a job, it makes me wonder how good a job they did repairing the frame...
that’s what disappointed me about it other than the insane price
I still think the Focus was the best buy I could make, tbh
I remember when looking around, I *could* find cheaper options
I know enough to look at the car fax, and one flag to check for is frame damage
But those vehicles were generally 150k+ miles and 2008 or earlier
What the 93k on the focus told me was that the car was driven heavily in a 4 - 5 year period
what I’d really love is a tesla
But odds are it was a lot of highway driving
Because 12 - 15k a year is considered average, but this car was doing 19 - 23k
It's kinda hard to put that kind of mileage on a card without doing mostly highway xD
For reference, when I was in college, a single day of driving to / from campus was ~100 miles
On average, I drove 4 days a week for 15 weeks
So a whole year of college was roughly 12k miles for me

I find it harder and harder to do these updates for the app each time...
It's just 4 hours of the same repetitive fine movements
To give an idea of how reptitive this 2nd job I do is, and why I have a hard time doing it (even though it's only about 8 hours every month)
When updating a coupon, it's 30 minutes of sorting just so I can read the DB easily, and I have to do this every time I close the browser
~1.5 - 2 hours of creating new coupon entries, and 1.5 - 2 hours of copying the data over (yup, real high-tech setup we got over hyah)
Right now, I'm in the most tedious part, creating the new blank entries
In order to create a new coupon entry, it takes:
25 - 26 mouse clicks, 4 enter presses, and 6 presses of a side button on my mouse.  Plus some scrolling
Because I have to create each new entry from scratch with this backend.  No easy little template setup for me <3
How long do you think you guys would last? :P
...what I'd give to just be able to copy each entry and then change the start / end dates...
